item.title: Android user interface testing with Espresso - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how to test Android applications with the Android Espresso testing framework.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Using the Gradle build system in the Eclipse IDE - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes how to use the Gradle tooling in Eclipse
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Unit tests with Mockito - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial explains testing with the Mockito framework from within the Eclipse IDE.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: SWT - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes SWT the user interface toolkit used by the Eclipse IDE. This article was written using Eclipse 4.4 (Luna).
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Unit tests with Mockito - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial explains testing with the Mockito framework from within the Eclipse IDE.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Unit Testing with JUnit - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial explains unit testing with JUnit 4.x. It explains the creation of JUnit tests. It also covers the usage of the Eclipse IDE for developing software tests.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Unit Testing with JUnit - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial explains unit testing with JUnit 4.x. It explains the creation of JUnit tests. It also covers the usage of the Eclipse IDE for developing software tests.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Android application and activity life cycle - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how the Android application and activity life cycle works.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Android application (performance and more) analysis tools - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes the available tools in Android to perform a performance analysis of Android applications.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Android background processing with Handlers, AsyncTask and Loaders - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes the usage of asynchronous processing in Android applications. It also covers how to handle the application life cycle together with threads. It is based on Android Studio.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Using lists and grids in Android with RecylerView - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how to use the RecylerView view together with activities and fragments in Android. The tutorial is based on Android 5.0.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Debugging Android applications - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how to debug Android applications.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Using the Android Toolbar (ActionBar) - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how to use the toolbar widget in your Android application. It is based on Android 6.0.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Register for the Eclipse 4 application life cycle - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how to use an life cycle handler for Eclipse RCP application.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Migrating Eclipse 3.x plug-ins and RCP applications to Eclipse 4 - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial gives an overview on how to migrate Eclipse components and application based on the Eclipse 3.x application model to Eclipse 4. This also includes using the compatibility layer in the Eclipse platform to run plug-ins based on the Eclipse 3.x API.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Using FreeMarker templates (FTL)- Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial explains how can you define FreeMarker templates and how can you generate output based on these templates. It also demonstrates the usage of macros.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Eclipse Fragment Projects - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes the purpose and usage of Eclipse fragment projects
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Eclipse product and application deployment - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how the product configuration file and the deployment process of Eclipse RCP applications. It is based on Eclipse 4.2 (Eclipse Juno).
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Java Annotations and Java Reflection - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how to define your own annotations and how to use Java reflection to analyze your code with it.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Eclipse 4 RCP - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial gives an overview about the Eclipse 4 application platform. This tutorial describes the creation of Eclipse 4 based applications, e.g., Eclipse RCP applications. It describes the modeled application concept and the new programming model which is based on annotations and dependency injection.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Google Maps Android API v2 - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes the usage of Google Maps in your Android application. It is based on Eclipse 4.4, Java 1.7 and Android 4.4.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Solutions for common Android development problems with the Eclipse IDE- Tutorial
item.description: This article lists common problems during Android development with the Eclipse IDE and potential solutions.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: OSGi Services - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial explains the usage of OSGi services primary focusing on the usage of declarative services. Eclipse Equinox is used as an stand-alone OSGi server. For this tutorial Eclipse 4.4 (Luna) is used.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: How to implement an ArrayList structure in Java - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes how to implement a list data structure in Java. The implementations in this articles are for demonstration and education purpose. They do not try to be as efficient as the standard libraries and they are not intended to be an replacement for the standard Java libraries structures.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Eclipse Tycho for building Eclipse Plug-ins and RCP applications - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes the usage of Eclipse Tycho to build Eclipse plug-ins and Eclipse RCP applications. This tutorial is based on Eclipse 4.5 and Tycho 0.23.0.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Android Camera API - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how to use the camera API in Android. The tutorial is based on Eclipse 4.2, Java 1.6 and Android 4.2.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Android Intents - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorials describes the usage of intents to communicate between Android components. It is based on Eclipse 4.4, Java 1.6 and Android 4.4.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Android Live Wallpaper - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes the creation of live wallpapers for Android. It is based on Eclipse 4.2, Java 1.6 and Android 4.1 (Ice Cream Sandwich).
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Android Notifications - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes how to use the Notification Manager in Android. It is based on Android Studio and Android 5.0.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Android BroadcastReceiver - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how to create and consume Android services. It is based on Eclipse 4.3, Java 1.6 and Android 4.2.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Eclipse Commands Advanced - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes use cases for Eclipse commands which go beyond the simple one for adding commands to menus, toolbars, etc. This article is based on Eclipse Indigo (3.7).
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Android Services - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how to create and consume Android services. It is based on Eclipse 4.3, Java 1.6 and Android 4.4.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Scheduling of tasks in Android with the AlarmManager and the JobScheduler - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how to schedule tasks in Android. It looks at the AlarmManager as well on the JobScheduler API.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Android Gestures - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how to use Gestures and the GestureOverylayVIew in Android. The tutorial is based on Eclipse 3.6, Java 1.6 and Android 2.3 (Gingerbread).
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Using lists in Android (ListView) - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how to use the ListView view together with activities and fragments in Android. The tutorial is based on Android 5.0.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: JAXB - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial give an introduction to Java Architecture for XML Binding (JAXB). This tutorial is based on Java 6.0.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Eclipse Editor Plugin - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how to create an editor and how this editor can be filled from a view. The tutorial is based on Eclipse 3.7 (Eclipse Indigo).
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Google App Engine for Java - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes the creation of a Java web application on the Google App Engine. It uses JPA. The tutorial is based on Java 1.7, Eclipse 4.4 and GAE version 1.4.2.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: REST with Java (JAX-RS) using Jersey - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial explains how to develop RESTful web services in Java with the JAX-RS reference implementation Jersey. In this tutorial Eclipse 4.4 (Luna), Java 1.6, Tomcat 6.0 and JAX-RS 2.0 (with Jersey 2.11) is used.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Testing with EasyMock - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial explains testing with the EasyMock framework within Eclipse. It is based on the EasyMock 3.1 release.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) - Tutorial
item.description: This article explains how to use CSS for styling HTML pages.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: XSLT - Extensible Stylesheet Language for Transformations - Tutorial
item.description: This articles explains how to do a XSLT transformations on the command line or via the Eclipse XSL project.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Android Networking - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes how to access web resources via HTTP in Android. It is based on Eclipse 4.4, Java 1.6 and Android 5.0 (Lollipop).
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Introduction to Android development with Android Studio - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how to create Android applications. It describes the usage of Android Studio. It is based on Android 5.0 (Lollipop).
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Android Location API - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes the usage of the Android Location API. It is based on Eclipse 3.7, Java 1.6 and Android 4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich).
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: How to implement common datastructures (List, Stack, Map) in plain Java - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes how to implement data structures (List Stack, Map) in Java. The implementations in this articles are for demonstration and education purpose. They do not try to be as efficient as the standard libraries and they are not intended to be an replacement for the standard libraries.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Eclipse Zest - Tutorial
item.description: Eclipse Zest is a visualization toolkit for graphs. This tutorial explains how to create directly a Zest graph and how to use the JFace abstraction. In this tutorial Eclipse 3.6 (Eclipse Helios) is used.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Apache Derby Database - Tutorial
item.description: This articles explains how to install the Apache Derby database, how to start the Derby server, how to connect via Java to Derby and how to use the Derby command line tool to issue SQL statements. The installation of Apache Derby as Windows Service is also explained.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: MySQL and Java JDBC - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how to use Java JDBC to connect to MySQL and perform SQL queries, database inserts and deletes.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: MySQL - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial explains how to install MySQL and how to create and query a database. This tutorial is using Ubuntu. This article uses Java 1.6 and MySQL 5.5.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Quicksort in Java - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes how to implement Quicksort with Java.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Mergesort in Java - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes how to implement Mergesort with Java.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Eclipse RCP and Plugin Internationalization - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes how to externalize your strings in Eclipse RCP and Eclipse plug-ins and how to support different languages. Includes how to translate your Eclipse 4.x workbench model. This article is based on Eclipse 4.2 (Eclipse Juno).
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Eclipse Modeling Framework (EMF) - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes the usage of Eclipse EMF, a framework for modeling your data model and creating Java code from it. This tutorial is based on Eclipse 4.5 (Mars).
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Using the Checkstyle Eclipse plug-in - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial will describe the usage of the Checkstyle plug-in for Eclipse.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: FindBugs in Eclipse - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes the usage of the Findbugs plug-in for Eclipse. It is based on Eclipse 4.4.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: How to create Eclipse plugins from jars - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes how to create Eclipse plugins (OSGi bundles) from standard Java libraries delivered as JAR files. This article is based on Eclipse 4.4.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Java Networking - Using HttpURLConnection to download files from the Internet - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes how to use the java.net package to access the web resources. The setting of a proxy is also described.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Creating PDF with Java and iText - Tutorial
item.description: This article demonstrate how to create PDF files with Java and the iText library. In this tutorial iText version 5.0.x is used
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: JFreeChart - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes the usage of the Java library JFreeChart. As example we create a pie chart.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Eclipse Preferences - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes the usage of Eclipse preferences and preference pages. Within this tutorial Eclipse 4.4 (Luna) is used.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Javascript - Tutorial
item.description: The article contains a introduction to JavaScript and JSON.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Towers of Hanoi - Java - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes how to solve the Towers of Hanoi in Java.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Eclipse JDT - Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) and the Java Model - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how the Eclipse JDT (Java Development Tools) and the Eclipse AST (Abstract Syntax Tree) can be used to access, change and read the elements of a Java program. In this tutorial Eclipse 4.4 is used.Level of this tutorial: Advanced
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Prime Factorization - Algorithm in Java - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how to perform prime factorization of an integer with Java.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Determine Prime Number with the Sieve of Eratosthenes - Algorithm in Java - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes the calculation of prime numbers with the sieve of Eratosthenes in Java
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Shuffle an Array or a List - Algorithm in Java - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes how to shuffle the content of an array or a list in Java. After the shuffle the elements in the array or the list are randomly sorted.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Euclid's algorithm for the greatest common divisor in Java - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes how to calculate in Java the greatest common divisor of two positive number with Euclid's algorithm.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Java web development with Eclipse WTP - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes the development of servlets with Eclipse WTP. This tutorial is based on Eclipse 4.4 (Luna) and Tomcat 7.0 and JDK 1.6.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Java concurrency (multi-threading) - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes how to do concurrent programming with Java. It covers the concepts of parallel programming, immutability, threads, the executor framework (thread pools), futures, callables CompletableFuture and the fork-join framework.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Eclipse Forms API - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes how to build user interfaces using Eclipse Forms.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Extending the Eclipse IDE - Plug-in development - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes the creation and deployment of Eclipse plug-ins. The article is based on Eclipse 4.4 (Luna) and Java 1.6.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Eclipse Source Code - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial explains how to work with the Eclipse source code. It assumes that you are already familiar with using the Eclipse IDE and is based on Eclipse 4.4 (Eclipse Luna).
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Adding menus, toolbar and popup menus to the Eclipse IDE - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorials describes how to add commands, menus and toolbar entries to the Eclipse IDE. This article is based on Eclipse Kepler (4.3).
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Apache Ant - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes the usage of Ant as a build tool to compile Java code, pack this code into an executable jar and how to create Javadoc. The usage of Ant is demonstrated within Eclipse and from the command line. This tutorial is based on Apache Ant 1.8.x.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Java Regex - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial introduces the usage of regular expressions and describes their implementation in Java. It also provides several Java regular expression examples.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Google App Engine - Python Development (with Eclipse) - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes the creation of a web application with Python on the Google App Engine. The example created in this article will be a simple Todo list. The usage of the email API will get demonstrated. Also conditions in the Django web template and formating of dates will get demonstrated. The article demonstrates optionally the usage of Eclipse for developing, running and debugging the Google App Engine application.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: JSF (JavaServer Faces) - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes how to develop JavaServer Faces web applications with Eclipse WTP JSF tooling. It demonstrates managed beans, validators, external resource bundles and the JSF navigation concept. This tutorial was developed with Java 1.6, JavaServerFaces 1.2, the Apache MyFaces JSF implementation, Tomcat 6.0 and Eclipse 3.6.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: GWT - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how to develop a Web application with GWT and the Google Plugin for Eclipse. This article assumes basic Eclipse and Java knowledge. The tutorial was developed using JDK 1.6, GWT 2.3 and Eclipse 3.7.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: OSGi Modularity - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial gives an overview of OSGi and its modularity layer. For this tutorial Eclipse 4.4 (Luna) is used.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Eclipse Extension Points and Extensions - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes the definition and usage of the Eclipse Extension Points. The article is written for and Eclipse 4.2 but you can easily adjust it for Eclipse 3.x.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: The Spring Jdbc Template for database access - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes the usage of the Spring JDBC Template in a stand-alone application.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Eclipse RCP based on the 3.x API - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how to develop Eclipse RCP applications with Eclipse 3.x API.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: JFace Data Binding - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial explains Eclipse JFace Data Binding which can be used to synchronize data between different objects. This tutorial is based on Eclipse 4.4 and Java 1.7.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Dependency Injection with the Spring Framework - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes how to use dependency injection with the Spring Framework. It first describes dependency injection as a general principle, gives then an overview of Spring and explains then the configuration of Spring with annotations and with XML.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Reporting with Eclipse BIRT and Java Objects (POJO's) - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial describes how to use Eclipse BIRT for reporting on simple Java Objects (POJO's). The tutorial explains also how to deploy the resulting BIRT report into a webcontainer (Tomcat) and how to use it in an Eclipse RCP application. Eclipse 3.7 (Indigo) is used for this tutorial.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Grails Development - Tutorial
item.description: This article explains how to build a Grails application. This article is based on Java 1.6 and Grails 2.4.4.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Excel and Java - Read and Write Excel with Java - Tutorial
item.description: This article demonstrate how to create and how to read Excel files with the Java Excel API.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: JPA 2.0 with EclipseLink - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial explains how to use EclipseLink, the reference implementation for the Java Persistence API (JPA). The usage of EclipseLink is demonstrated for stand-alone Java applications (outside the Java EE environment). The EclipseLink 2.3.X implementation is used for this tutorial.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Ajax with the Dojo Toolkit - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes the usage of the Dojo toolkit for JavaScript programming. Dojo is an Ajax toolkit.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Java and XML - Tutorial
item.description: This article gives an introduction into XML and its usage with Java. The Java Streaming API for XML (Stax) and the Java XPath library are explained and demonstrated.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: RSS feeds with Java - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial explains how to read and create RSS feeds with Java. It uses the Stax XML API. Eclipse is used as the Java IDE and Java7 is used.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Introduction to the Eclipse JFace Table API - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial explains the usage of Eclipse JFace TableViewer including label and content provider. This tutorial is based on Eclipse 4.3.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: DocBook - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial explains how to write DocBook files in Eclipse and how to convert these files into various output formats, e.g., to HTML and PDF. It also explains how to configure XInclude to divide the information into different source files. This tutorial uses Docbook 4.5, the Saxon XLST processor in version 6.5.5, Eclipse 4.3 and the XLST stylesheets in version 1.77.1.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Microsoft and Java Integration with Eclipse - Tutorial
item.description: This article will demonstrate how Eclipse SWT can be used to integrate / use Microsoft applications. Eclipse is using the SWT GUI framework. SWT does allow to integrated Microsoft application via OLE (Object Linking and Embedding).Microsoft Outlook, Microsoft Excel and the File explorer are used as examples. The examples used are based on Eclipse RCP as this makes it easy to demonstrate the usage but work also with stand-alone Java application (which are using SWT). This article assumes that you are already familiar with using the Eclipse IDE and with developing simple Eclipse RCP applications.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Java Logging API - Tutorial
item.description: This article describes how to use the Logging API in Java programs. It includes an example for creating an HTML logger.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)

item.title: Java Preferences API - Tutorial
item.description: This tutorial gives a introduction into the Java Preference API to save key/value pairs for a Java application.
item.author: lars.vogel@vogella.com (Lars Vogel)
